channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: CrowdStrike Reveals What Happened, Why—And What’s Changed
item.description: CrowdStrike has published its Root Cause Analysis report, an investigation into what caused the IT outage in July. Here's what it says.

item.title: Misunderstanding bigness
item.description: IBM spent a fortune fighting calls for them to be broken up. So did AT&T and Microsoft. In all three cases, there’s plenty of evidence that they would have been better off if they had simply broken themselves up. Microsoft is still recovering and IBM never will. One computer company, one phone company, one software […]

item.title: Mobile Ads: Best Practices, Benefits And Challenges
item.description: If you’re ready to pan for gold in mobile advertising, keep concerns like data, privacy and user experience in mind.

item.title: The challenge of “a risky scheme”
item.description: New ideas aren’t adopted all at once. A few people go first while the rest of us watch to see how it goes. “Look, Mikey, he likes it!” This is the story of tech innovations, dance crazes and even food. Ideas spread horizontally, and people who prefer the status quo will embrace an idea only […]

item.title: Seven Business Development Tips For B2B Tech Startups
item.description: By developing an effective business development plan, you can draw a roadmap to achieve all your goals easily in the long run.

item.title: Learning in August
item.description: What better time? An hour a day for a month and you can learn a skill you’ll have forever. Beach reads are a fine way to chill out, but a month spent to learn a skill is a fine way to take advantage of a quiet time. My brand new course on Strategy is now […]

item.title: The Digital Control Tower: Beyond Supply Chain And Manufacturing
item.description: For many businesses, the digital control tower has become a transformative tool that offers visibility, agility and efficiency.

item.title: Reclaiming “fiasco”
item.description: Usually modified with “total,” the failure might not be as bad as we fear. The origin of the word probably comes from Italian, a long time ago. The person who loses a round in a game has to buy the next bottle for the group (from: flask). Which means that there is going to be […]

item.title: Wegovy And Zepbound Doses Available Again After Months Of Shortages, FDA Says—But Supplies Are Still Limited
item.description: Novo and Lilly have struggled to keep up with demand for semaglutide and tirzepatide—generic names for Ozempic, Wegovy, Mounjaro and Zepbound—and there have been reports people with diabetes have struggled to access the drugs as more people use them to lose weight.

item.title: The Mississippi River paradox
item.description: There’s no water in that river that was there ten years ago. The boundaries have shifted in that time as well, there’s no riverbank that’s exactly where it was. And the silt and the fish have all moved too. So, what’s “the Mississippi River”? It’s a label, a placeholder, and a marker–when the Mississippi does […]

item.title: The Rise Of Labs: Driving Innovation In Modern Enterprises
item.description: A strategic approach to developing successful labs can better enable enterprises to achieve more with less, save money and create new revenue opportunities.

item.title: Infamy
item.description: We’ve gotten so hung up on famous that it’s easy to forget that there are two kinds of renown. Being known for lowering the standards of discourse, cheating, or whining is a choice, but why would you trade your reputation to become infamous?

item.title: Farewell To Fighting: It’s Time To Embrace A Go-To-Market Offense
item.description: If you want your CS team to be a revenue driver, you must go beyond asking them to hit a number.

item.title: Stopping a runaway train
item.description: It feels urgent because it is. But by the time the train is running away, it might be too late. The better strategy is to not sign up for trains that are likely to run away. The first principle of risk reduction is to figure out if you can stop it later. If you can’t, […]

item.title: Generative AI Will Replace Everything: Rethinking User Experience
item.description: Generative and conversational AI will cause companies to rethink how they approach user experience in the coming years.

item.title: The tooth fairy
item.description: Make a list of things you used to believe. Fervently, certainly, completely. Things that you were sure of, but now, with the passage of time and the benefit of experience, you know to be incorrect or incomplete. Of course, it’s not just mythical creatures beloved by children. It’s our adherence to a social norm, loyalty […]

item.title: CVS Health CEO Takes Charge At Aetna After Insurer’s Latest Miss
item.description: CVS Health CEO Karen Lynch is taking over “day-to-day management” of the company’s Aetna health insurance business after its latest poor performance.

item.title: The last little bit
item.description: Important hills usually get much steeper at the top. 99% of the training in competitive athletics is devoted to the last 1% of performance. A tenth of a second. The same is true for squeezing the last bit of performance out of a car, a grape or a semiconductor. And healthcare, luxury goods and science […]

item.title: This Startup Raised $25 Million To Keep Data Safe While Training AI
item.description: “Confidential computing” startup Anjuna aims to make it possible for its customers to use sensitive data for a variety of tasks without compromising privacy.

item.title: What are you thinking about?
item.description: A philosopher can spend a month, a year or a career thinking about one knotty problem. Making assertions, testing theories, understanding how others are thinking about it as well. But this exercise shouldn’t be reserved for academics. What are you working on? When will you change your mind? What can you learn, what can you […]

item.title: Adjusting Your Security Speed To Keep Pace With SaaS Risks
item.description: The interconnected nature of SaaS offerings means that a vulnerability in one application can affect the entire supply chain.

item.title: This Secretive Billionaire Thinks He Can Cure HIV. Here’s Why.
item.description: By bringing together top doctors, scientists and engineers, Terry Ragon believes he can succeed where major governments have failed and cure one of the world’s wiliest viruses.

item.title: Winning AI: A Three-Legged Stool
item.description: By focusing on using AI to make your company better, you’ll more easily, reliably, safely and quickly recognize gains from the three legs of the generative AI industry.

item.title: From Cab To Console, Einride’s First Remote Electric RoboTruck Driver
item.description: After a decade in the cab of big rigs, Tiffany Heathcott is still delivering the goods aboard commercial trucks, only she's far from the drivers seat.

item.title: Hurricane Irma Inspired Engineers To Invent Self-Watering Planter
item.description: If you love your house plants but don't want to give up vacations, this self-watering planter can keep up to five house plants happy and healthy by creating its own water

item.title: Another Profitable Quarter For Oscar Health As Obamacare Business Grows
item.description: Oscar Health reported $56 million in net income – its second quarterly profit in the company’s 12-year history – as the provider of Obamacare grows its market share.

item.title: What Insurance Organizations Should Know About Open-Source AI
item.description: The integration of open-source AI solutions has been transformative in the insurance industry, offering a new level of transparency and collaboration.

item.title: NASA Urges Public To Leave The City For The Perseid Meteor Shower This Weekend
item.description: According to NASA, here's when and how to best see the Perseid meteor shower this weekend, as well as where to look and why to dress warmly.

item.title: Flighty 4.0: The iPhone Flight Tracking App Just Launched A Major Upgrade
item.description: The latest version of the popular flyer’s app adds a new feature which not only predicts delays but tells you why you’re waiting.

item.title: The ‘Escape From Tarkov’ Wipe Probably Isn’t Coming This Week Afterall
item.description: Some new info from members of the Escape From Tarkov development team suggests that the next wipe might not launch this week as we initially thought.

item.title: How The U.S. Could Transform Its Drone Industry For The Price Of One F-35
item.description: George Matus, founder and CEO of drone maker Teal, argues that a just small investment would enable the Pentagon to mass produce small combat drones at low cost.

item.title: Harnessing Generative AI For Sustainable Food Systems Innovation
item.description: Generative AI is emerging as a game-changer in driving innovation, with significant social and environmental potential at the food-health-climate nexus.

item.title: Ozempic Maker Novo Nordisk Sinks On Disappointing Earnings
item.description: Novo Nordisk’s growth has slowed in recent weeks as the company struggles to produce enough semaglutide to meet stellar demand for Wegovy and Ozempic.

item.title: Apple iPhone 16, iPhone 16 Pro Release Date: New Report Reveals Extraordinary Strategy
item.description: It’s a little over a month, it seems, before Apple will announce its next iPhones—and an industry heavyweight just disclosed an interesting theory.

item.title: Google Updates Millions Of Pixel Phones—Dangerous New Threat Confirmed
item.description: You must update your device as soon as possible.
